title.rendered: Confessions of an Imperfect Church Message Series

content.rendered:
CONFESSIONS OF AN IMPERFECT CHURCH

We would be the first to admit: The Church is certainly not what it ought to be! The Church has not always been as forthcoming about our faults and failures. Join us as we seek to be as honest about the failures of the Church and to talk about how we can more humbly represent Jesus Christ our Savior! We intend to validate those who have had valid criticisms of the Church, and to articulate what the Church should be.

Next Steps Pastor

Rev. Nathan Adkison

Nathan was born in Macon, GA and grew up in Warner Robins, GA. He served in the Georgia Army National Guard for six years. After taking a little break from the military life, he rejoined in the Georgia Air National Guard before switching to become an officer in the Air Force Reserves where he currently serves. He has worked in the government as a contractor and a civil servant as a software developer for nearly 20 years.

He started volunteering at Crosspoint in 2012 where he took on several roles such as the 5th/6th Grade Minister and the Military Minister. He is excited to be appointed to Crosspoint, Niceville as the Next Steps Pastor.

He received his Bachelor degree in Information Technology from American InterContinental University; his Master of Science degree in Computer Science from Columbus State University; his Master of Arts degree in Christian Studies with an Emphasis in Christian Leadership from Grand Canyon University, and is in his final year for his Master of Divinity degree from Asbury Theological Seminary.

Nathan has been married to Kim since December 2005. They have three beautiful girls: Megan Porter, Kylee Gallavan, and Michaela Adkison, and a son-in-law, Cole Porter.

Email: nadkison@yourcrosspoint.org

Phone: 850-678-4411, ext. 138

Follow Nathan

Share this Page

DAVID

Israel’s King David is one of the Bible’s most famous people. We tend to look at Bible heroes through rose-colored glasses, but David was a man of great “highs” and terrible “lows” and the Bible doesn’t whitewash the flaws of this hero of the faith. In spite of it all, the Bible refers to David as “a man after God’s own heart”! Join us in this summer series as we look at a great number of lessons that we can learn from David–lessons that are as relevant and helpful today as then.

title.rendered: The Problem of God Message Series

content.rendered:
THE PROBLEM OF GOD

Have you ever been skeptical about God? Had a crisis in your faith journey and wondered, “Why is this happening?” or “Where is God in all of this?” or maybe, “Is there even a God at all?” The Problem of God will explore the claims of Christianity. Far from being irrational, Christianity welcomes and encourages intellectual questioning. Belief in God and the Christian faith is both rational and compelling. Join us for this seven-week series as we create a safe and honest space to answer these questions. Your faith will be challenged no matter where you are on that journey!

GREATER THAN

Everyone wants to experience a taste of greatness in life. It’s what drives so many to competition in every arena of life from sports to music, academics to fashion, and even in cooking. Yes we all dream of being known as the GOAT­-the greatest of all time. When it comes to our faith, who does the Bible say is the greatest? The author of the book of Hebrews gives us a very clear picture of who they think is the greatest of all time. Join us as we see who is greater than all the rest.

ENOUGH

In order to accomplish God’s plan, it is going to take all of us asking ourselves a question, “What is ENOUGH?” This may be the most important question we ask ourselves in 2018 as we consider all that God might do if we take that question seriously and invest in things that matter for eternity! Imagine if we had more than ENOUGH, and together were able to reach more families, more kids, more teenagers, and start more campuses? Join us for two messages that have the potential of changing the trajectory of our church and our lives!

Click here to make a commitment to invest in what God is doing at Crosspoint.

BEGIN (AGAIN)

Everyone needs a second chance (and more likely a third, fourth, fifth and on and on). What if God and your next chance were right around the corner? What if God’s not angry, but full of grace and mercy? Come begin the New Year by discovering this second chance God of redemption, all throughout the Bible, and choose to Begin (Again)!

CHRISTMAS MIRACLES

During the Christmas season we celebrate the biggest miracle of all time: the fact that God—the creator of the universe—became human! But because of the “hustle and bustle” of the season we’re often prone to overlook the gravity of that event, much less the hundreds of other miracles made possible because of it. Join us as we pause to reflect on several of this season’s “Christmas Miracles”!

WHAT’S THE POINT?

Have you ever read the Bible and not understood what it meant and asked, “What’s the Point?” Jesus had an incredible way of explaining the hidden truths and difficult teachings of God that He was revealing. He did it by using everyday stories (parables) about common life that everyone could understand…if they were really interested. He explained things about our heart, our needs, our stuff, loving people, and the cost of following Jesus–in understandable ways that both challenged His listeners and gave new understanding to His followers. Join us as we discover the point of what Jesus taught us about life in simple ways!

UNDER NEW MANAGEMENT

When a business is “under new management” it can change the way the business looks, the service it offers, and the products it produces. New management can turn failing businesses into successful businesses and enable small companies to become large corporations. In the same way, a personal “change in management” can help someone find new direction; move from being a negative influence to having a powerful, positive impact on others; enable a father who has failed his family time and time again escape the downward spiral; and give a teenager who sees no reason for waking up purpose and a calling to something much bigger than himself. In the “Under New Management” series we will discover how that is possible.

SERVE CROSSPOINT CREATIVE

Opportunities for Artists and Technicians

Crosspoint Creative is dedicated to connecting people to Christ through the arts by providing opportunities for people to meet Christ in the church and the community. Serving with Creative means using your God-given gifts in the arts to create engaging environments for worship. Whether you are an artist or a technician, there is a place for you to serve.

Artists

Vocalists
AUDITION PROCESS

Anyone who wishes to audition for our worship team should prepare to sing lead and harmony on one of our commonly-scheduled worship songs. Lyric sheets and videos can be found on Planning Center (see below for log in instructions). Auditions can take place on campus with a staff member or through video submission.

If you wish to audition on campus, please request an audition time. A worship leader from your campus will contact you as soon as possible to schedule a time to meet for your audition.

If you wish to submit a video audition, please record and upload a video to YouTube or Vimeo and include the link in the audition request form. In your video you should introduce yourself as well as sing melody through at least one verse and one chorus and harmony through at least one verse and one chorus of one of the songs listed above.

Ready to audition, or want more information? Fill out our contact form!

Instrumentalists
AUDITION PROCESS

Anyone who wishes to audition for our worship team should prepare to play one of our commonly-scheduled worship songs. Chord charts and isolation tracks for select songs can be found on Planning Center (see below for log in information).

Our bands play along to a click track with a metronome and verbal cues that help keep everyone in the band together when playing. Isolation tracks are mixed so you can hear your instrument over everything else, and you can hear the metronome and cues we use on Sunday mornings.

Auditions can take place on campus with a staff member or through video submission.

If you wish to audition on campus, please request an audition time. A worship leader from your campus will contact you as soon as possible to schedule a time to meet for your audition.

If you wish to submit a video audition, please record and upload a video to YouTube or Vimeo and include the link in the audition request form. In your video you should introduce yourself as well as play through one of the songs listed above.

Ready to audition, or want more information? Fill out our contact form!

Planning Center Information
We want to provide you with every possible resource in preparing for your audition. Whether you are a vocalist or an instrumentalist, please use these login credentials to access our Auditions plan on Planning Center. Here you can find lyric sheets, chord charts, isolation tracks, and music videos to help you prepare. To log in, use the following credentials:

Email: cstaff@yourcrosspoint.org
Password: audition

If you have questions about how to use Planning Center, please contact Kat at kcombs@yourcrosspoint.org.

Other
Not all artists are musicians! If you are an artist seeking a place to serve, we want to find a place for you. Whether you are a writer, designer, painter, performer, or anything in between, your gifts are valued in the church. If you want to use your artistic talents to serve with Crosspoint Creative, please contact us to set up a meeting.

Technicians

Technicians
Between our 4 campuses we have 7 worship venues, each of which requires multiple technicians to help create an engaging worship service for our guests and regular attenders. If you have a passion for leading worship through running production, we would love to get you serving.

Whether you want to program lights, run slides, mix audio, or anything in between, we have a place for you to serve. No experience is necessary; we will train you in whatever position in which you have interest. To start serving, please contact the technical director at your campus.

Thank you for your interest in serving with Crosspoint Creative!

Privacy Policy

Protecting your private information is our priority. This Statement of Privacy applies to the yourcrosspoint.org and Crosspoint United Methodist Church and governs data collection and usage. For the purposes of this Privacy Policy, unless otherwise noted, all references to Crosspoint United Methodist Church include yourcrosspoint.org and Crosspoint. The Crosspoint website is a Church site. By using the Crosspoint website, you consent to the data practices described in this statement.

Collection of your Personal Information

Crosspoint may collect personally identifiable information, such as your name. If you purchase Crosspoint’s products and services, we collect billing and credit card information. This information is used to complete the purchase transaction. Crosspoint may also collect anonymous demographic information, which is not unique to you, such as your age and gender. We may gather additional personal or non-personal information in the future.

Information about your computer hardware and software may be automatically collected by Crosspoint. This information can include: your IP address, browser type, domain names, access times and referring website addresses. This information is used for the operation of the service, to maintain quality of the service, and to provide general statistics regarding use of the Crosspoint website.

Please keep in mind that if you directly disclose personally identifiable information or personally sensitive data through Crosspoint’s public message boards, this information may be collected and used by others.

Crosspoint encourages you to review the privacy statements of websites you choose to link to from Crosspoint so that you can understand how those websites collect, use and share your information. Crosspoint is not responsible for the privacy statements or other content on websites outside of the Crosspoint website.

Use of your Personal Information

Crosspoint collects and uses your personal information to operate its website(s) and deliver the services you have requested.

Crosspoint may also use your personally identifiable information to inform you of other products or services available from Crosspoint and its affiliates. Crosspoint may also contact you via surveys to conduct research about your opinion of current services or of potential new services that may be offered.

Crosspoint does not sell, rent or lease its customer lists to third parties.

Crosspoint may share data with trusted partners to help perform statistical analysis, send you email or postal mail, provide customer support, or arrange for deliveries. All such third parties are prohibited from using your personal information except to provide these services to Crosspoint, and they are required to maintain the confidentiality of your information.

Crosspoint will disclose your personal information, without notice, only if required to do so by law or in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to: (a) conform to the edicts of the law or comply with legal process served on Crosspoint or the site; (b) protect and defend the rights or property of Crosspoint; and, (c) act under exigent circumstances to protect the personal safety of users of Crosspoint, or the public.

Security of your Personal Information

To secure your personal information from unauthorized access, use or disclosure, Crosspoint uses the following: Active Network, Shelby Systems

Children Under Thirteen

Crosspoint collects personally identifiable information from children under the age of thirteen. Crosspoint collects this information for the following reason(s): Children’s Ministries, Preschool, Childcare

We provide information about our personal data practices for children on our home page and wherever we knowingly collect personal data from children on our Web site. If you are under the age of thirteen, you must ask your parent or guardian for permission to use this website. If you are a parent and you have questions regarding our data collection practices, please contact us using the information provided at the end of this Statement of Privacy.

Disconnecting your Crosspoint Account from Third Party Websites

You will be able to connect your Crosspoint account to third party accounts. BY CONNECTING YOUR CROSSPOINT ACCOUNT TO A THIRD PARTY ACCOUNT, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT YOU ARE CONSENTING TO THE CONTINUOUS RELEASE OF INFORMATION ABOUT YOU TO OTHERS (IN ACCORDANCE WITH YOUR PRIVACY SETTINGS ON THOSE THIRD PARTY SITES). IF YOU DO NOT WANT INFORMATION ABOUT YOU, INCLUDING PERSONALLY IDENTIFYING INFORMATION, TO BE SHARED IN THIS MANNER, DO NOT USE THAT FEATURE. You may disconnect your account from a third party account at any time. User may log out from third-party websites on the visited page.

Opt-Out & Unsubscribe

We respect your privacy and give you an opportunity to opt-out of receiving announcements of certain information. Users may opt-out of receiving any or all communications from Crosspoint by contacting us here: Web page: yourcrosspoint.org/contact ; Email: info@yourcrosspoint.org; Phone: 850-678-4411

Changes to this Statement

Crosspoint will occasionally update this Statement of Privacy to reflect company and customer feedback. Crosspoint encourages you to periodically review this Statement to be informed of how Crosspoint is protecting your information.

Contact Information

Crosspoint welcomes your questions or comments regarding this Statement of Privacy. If you believe that Crosspoint has not adhered to this Statement, please contact Crosspoint at:

Niceville, Florida 32578

COLOSSIANS

Did you know that most of the New Testament in the Bible is made up of letters? A guy named Paul wrote many of those letters to teach and encourage Followers of Jesus in his time concerning many of the same issues we still deal with, and think about, today. Join us this summer as we dive deeper into Paul’s letter to the Colossians to understand in a fresh way who Jesus is, and what it means to live as His Follower.

CROSSPOINT SERVES

Do you desire to lead a life that looks more like Christ?

Please consider attending Crosspoint Serves:

Sunday, August 19, 10:45-noon, in the Crosspoint Theatre in the Community Life Center.

We believe you become like Christ as you serve others. We know God has uniquely gifted, called, and equipped you. Please join us at Crosspoint Serves to find out how! And enjoy some amazing food and time with our Ministry Leaders as well! For more information, contact Nathan Adkison, 850-678-4411, ext. 138, or nadkison@yourcrosspoint.org.

View Crosspoint Serves Form

Volunteer News & Schedules

Newly Announced & Open Opportunities

GUEST SERVICES: MORE THAN A DOOR
Do you remember the first time that you came to Crosspoint? We hope you felt welcomed by our Guest Services Team before attending worship. Our Parking Team helps folks find the best spot on our lot and our Shuttle Team is happy to drive guests in from most any place on campus. Our Hosts help new guests find their way around the Niceville campus and help returning guests get more connected. Our Holy Grounds Team keeps our coffee and snacks coming all morning long! Finally, our Ushers are happy to help guests find the right service as well as a comfortable chair! Please contact Kim Adkison at kadkison@yourcrosspoint.org if you’d like to serve once a month in any area of Guest Services. Please join us in helping folks come as they are and meet Jesus! We’d love to have you. View current openings

FLIPPED

Jesus had a way of turning this world upside-down. From performing miracles that up-ended the laws of nature to turning societal structures and social paradigms on their heads, Jesus inverted the things of this world so that we could more clearly see the realities beyond our world. Join us the next few weeks as we allow our perspectives to be FLIPPED.

THE LIFE

Nobody had a bigger impact on history than Jesus. His life was a life well lived, and for those who follow Him, He calls us to live life like He did. But what does that mean? How can we live like Jesus did? Join us for our new sermon series called “The Life” as we draw closer to Easter and explore what it means to live “The Life” Jesus calls us to live.

title.rendered: Being Rich: In What Matters Most Message Series

BEING RICH: IN WHAT MATTERS MOST

A nicer house, newer car, better paying job, or even just more of the basics: wanting more isn’t always bad, but are we looking for satisfaction in all the wrong places? Join us for this series as we put a fresh perspective on what being ‘rich’ really means and how God wants us to respond to His blessings.

STARTING POINT

Everything has a starting point—your life, your relationships, your education, your career. Everything starts somewhere, including faith.  Whether you’re new to faith, curious about God, coming back to church after some time away, or have been a Christian for a while, this series takes us back to the beginning.  Join us as we start the new year by discovering, or rediscovering, in an open and honest way what it means to believe.

MOVE

At particular times and places God has moved in incredible, maybe even miraculous ways that have ushered in widespread revival among Christians and unprecedented numbers of people turning to Christ. When we look around at our broken world, our hearts cry out, “Do it again Lord, do it again.”

MOVE is about asking God through concerted, intentional, passionate prayer to move in our hearts, our church and our community. It is about us being willing to move as the Holy Spirit leads us to repent, seek God more earnestly and reach out more faithfully. Finally, MOVE is about expecting a movement of God like we have never seen before.

STOLEN CHRISTMAS

Christmas is not just a season of giving and receiving… if we’re not careful it can also be a time of taking, seizing, and stealing! Join us over the next four weeks as we discover some of the “thieves” that prowl around each Christmas, and how to overcome their devious schemes.

DON’T TWEET THIS

There are lots of religious clichés that we have all heard, believed, and even lived out, but are they really God’s truth?  Before you tweet or repeat another one of these sayings, join us as we discover together what God really has to say about these topics. Sometimes things that “sound good” are not “good and sound” biblically.

DON’T GO TO CHURCH

You can’t really go to church, because the church is not a building. Christ followers everywhere who are impacting their communities are the true Church. Join us as we discover what the church is, what it  isn’t, and the roles we need to play to be the church.

Executive Pastor

Rev. Taylor Brown

Taylor was born in Panama City, FL and considers it his hometown despite living in different parts of the country over the course of his life (Roswell, NM; San Diego, CA; Colorado Springs, CO; Martin, TN). He attended the University of Tennessee and graduated with a B.S. in Business and a Masters in Business Administration. Prior to coming to Crosspoint, he served for 7 years at Northstar Church in Panama City, FL as the Financial/Admin Pastor.

Taylor has always had a wide spectrum of interests – playing college football, playing soccer, musical theater, ping-pong, playing guitar, singing, reading, business, real estate, financial coaching, and Excel. He loves helping people take next steps in their relationship with God, equipping them to use their God given talents/abilities, and mentoring people in their personal finances so that they can experience a life of financial freedom and generosity.

Taylor has been married to Cori since June 2010 and together they have one amazing son, Hudson.

Email: tbrown@yourcrosspoint.org

Phone: 678-4411, ext. 185

Follow Taylor:   

Share this Page

MIND CONTROL

Sometimes we feel like we are under attack! It’s because we are! The war is waged in our minds and the enemy uses every tool in his arsenal to smash our outlook and our relationship with God. We can fight back. We must fight back.

THINK SMALL

We’re a Big Church that Thinks Small… as in small groups. Church is more than Sunday mornings and it’s more than just sitting in a crowd. It’s being connected to a smaller group of others that you can do life together with. Small groups is our “Plan A” for getting to know God and others better. Life’s too hard to do alone, and God designed us to live in fellowship with others. Join us August 11 and 18 as we learn how to Think Small.

THE UNKNOWNS

We’ve all heard about the heroes of the Bible: Noah, Abraham, Moses, David, and Jesus. But what most of us don’t know is that tucked away in the shadows of scripture are The Unknowns. Though they regularly get passed over as irrelevant nobodies, The Unknowns are often people of deep faith who lived with incredible obedience and show us that even seemingly insignificant people can teach us profound lessons and have a big impact. Who knows? That may very well be our story, too! Join us over the next 6 weeks as we learn extraordinary lessons from ordinary people.

GO

GO and make disciples. It’s the highest call of Christ’s followers. Here at Crosspoint, we know the power of GO because we’ve experienced first-hand how God can use a faithful, obedient church to reach new people. What we have experienced in going to Crestview to start campuses is just the beginning of a bigger movement of God. We believe God is positioning us to not only reach Okaloosa County, but to reach Northwest Florida and beyond.  Are you ready to GO?

WORSHIP AUDITIONS

Auditions will be held in the Crosspoint Café on April 17, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

We are excited about all that God is doing in and through our worship ministry, and are excited about hearing from each of you.

If you would like to audition for multiple instruments, or an instrument and vocals, please be prepared to audition for each of these areas.

We will follow up with everyone who auditions within the next couple of weeks.

If you are unable to attend the all call, please submit a video recording of you playing or singing the required material.

If there are any other questions, please contact Josh Johnson via email at jjohnson@yourcrosspoint.org.

content.rendered:
[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

TRANSFORMED

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”0px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

Ever say, “There’s got to be more to life than this?” The world shouts for our attention with answers to our relationship struggles, our financial trouble, and our search for meaning. But is the advice we get really working? Don’t keep doing the same things in the same old ways. Don’t stay the same! This January, join us as we discover the power to change our lives–to be TRANSFORMED.

[/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

Messages from this Series

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”15px” border=”none” bg_color=”#0078ae”][vc_column width=”1/1″ fade_animation=”in” fade_animation_offset=”45px” style=”color:#ffffff;”]

[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

UNWRAPPING CHRISTMAS

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”0px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

Any of us have heard the traditional Christmas story, but did you know Jesus is the culmination of the Christmas story that God has been giving us from the very beginning? Join us this Advent season as we Unwrap Christmas and take a deeper look into the Old Testament book of Isaiah, to examine the beautiful and mysterious gift of Christ.

CROSSPOINT ACADEMY CLASS OPTIONS

We occasionally have openings in our current school year preschool & childcare classes. Please call (850) 678-4411 ext. 187 or email lmcelroy@yourcrosspoint.org to inquire about our current year availability.

Preschool Class Options, Rates & Policies

2018-2019 PRESCHOOL CLASS OPTIONS

3-Year Old Programs | 9:00 a.m. – 2:30 p.m. | August 14, 2018 – May 2019

Enrollment is open to any toilet-trained child who is 3 years old by September 1, 2018

Days Days of Week Monthly Tuition
2 Days Tuesday & Thursday $230
3 Days Tuesday – Thursday $280
5 Days Monday – Friday $450
  • Registration Fee: $100
  • Supply Fee: $50 (includes Academy tote bag)
  • Registration & supply fee are non-refundable & non-transferable
  • Monthly Tuition: due the 1st day of each month from July 2018 – April 2019
  • All class times and days may be subject to change due to enrollment numbers.
  • A 30-day written withdrawal notice is required for a partial or total refund to be considered.

4-Year Old Programs | 9:00 a.m. – 2:30 p.m. | August 14, 2018 – May 2019

Enrollment is open to any toilet-trained child who is 4 years old by September 1, 2018

Days Days of Week Monthly Tuition Tuition with VPK Voucher
3 Days Tuesday – Thursday $280 $0
5 Days Monday – Friday $450 $190
  • Registration Fee: $100 (covered by VPK)
  • Supply Fee: $50 (includes Academy tote bag, supply fee for 3-day students is covered by VPK) 
  • Registration & supply fee are non-refundable & non-transferable
  • Monthly Tuition: due the 1st day of each month from July 2018 – April 2019
  • All class times and days may be subject to change due to enrollment numbers.
  • A 30-day written withdrawal notice is required for a partial or total refund to be considered.
  • Crosspoint Academy annually reviews our participation in the state’s VPK program. All students registering prior to a determination of any VPK provider status are registering as tuition-based students. Registration fees will only be returned if Crosspoint Academy agrees to be a VPK provider for the 2018-2019 school year and parents choose to participate in the state’s VPK program.

EXTENDED CARE PROGRAM | 7:30 – 9:00 A.M. AND 2:30 – 5:30 P.M.

Enrollment is open to any student in our 3- or 4-year old program
Any combination of program days | $300 per month

  • Registration Fee: $75
  • Monthly Tuition: due the 1st day of each month from July 2018 – April 2019
Childcare Class Options, Rates & Policies

2018-2019 CHILDCARE CLASS OPTIONS

Part-Time Programs | 9:30 a.m. – 2:00 p.m. | August 14, 2018 – May 2019

Enrollment in toddler room is open to any child who is walking & not bottle fed.

Class Birth Date Range Days of Week Monthly Tuition
Toddler 8/15/16 – 7/14/17 Tuesday & Wednesday $250
2 Year Old 9/2/15 – 8/14/16 Tuesday & Wednesday $250
2 Year Old 9/2/15 – 8/14/16 Wednesday & Thursday $250
2 Year Old 9/2/15 – 8/14/16 Tuesday & Thursday $250
2 Year Old 9/2/15 – 8/14/16 Tuesday, Wednesday & Thursday $375
  • Registration Fee: $100
  • Supply Fee: $50
  • Registration & supply fee are non-refundable & non-transferable
  • Monthly Tuition: due the 1st day of each month from July 2018 – April 2019
  • All class times and days may be subject to change due to enrollment numbers.
  • A 30-day written withdrawal notice is required for a partial or total refund to be considered.

Full-Time Programs | 7:30 a.m. – 5:30 p.m. | August 14, 2018 – August 2019

Enrollment in toddler room is open to any child who is walking & not bottle fed.

Class Age Days of Week Monthly Tuition
Baby 7/15/17 – Present Monday – Friday $750
Toddler 8/15/16 – 7/14/17 Monday – Friday $750
2 Year Old 9/2/15 – 8/14/16 Monday – Friday $750
  • Registration Fee: $100
  • Supply Fee: $75
  • Registration & supply fee are non-refundable & non-transferable
  • Monthly Tuition: due the 1st day of each month from July 2018 – June 2019
  • All class times and days may be subject to change due to enrollment numbers.
  • A 30-day written withdrawal notice is required for a partial or total refund to be considered.
Summer Class Options, Rates & Policies

2018 SUMMER CLASS OPTIONS

Enrollment is open to any toilet-trained child that has previously completed either a 3- or 4-year preschool program during the 2017-2018 school year.

Type Days of the Week Hours Dates Tuition
Preschool Part-time Tuesday-Thursday 9:30 a.m. – 2:00 p.m. June 19 – Aug 2 $600
Preschool Full-time Monday-Friday 7:30 a.m. – 5:30 p.m. May 29 – Aug 9 $1875
  • Registration Fee: $50
  • Registration fee is non-refundable & non-transferable
  • Part-time Tuition: Half of tuition is due May 1 in the amount of $300, the balance is due June 1 in the amount of $300. All tuition must be paid prior to June 19 to ensure no delays in your child’s start date.
  • Full-time Tuition: The first tuition payment is due May 1 in the amount of $937.50. The final tuition payment is due June 1 in the amount of $937.50. 
  • All class times and days may be subject to change due to enrollment numbers.
  • A 30-day written withdrawal notice is required for a partial or total refund to be considered.

Crosspoint Academy Calendar

Calendar

2018-2019 Crosspoint Academy Calendar (PDF) 

*All dates are subject to change, based on the school calendar.

Transformations

Transformations is a ministry that aims to expand the community’s perspectives about poverty.  Explore new, locally pertinent solutions.  And empower individuals to break out of poverty using their own abilities and the support of community partners.
Transformations Brochure

The best way to get a sense of what they do is to take a look at the results:
Transformations Graduation 2016
Transformation Graduation 2015

Return to Missions Page

Learn More

I Would Like to be Student Investigator
Student Investigators are people looking to make a positive change in their own lives. If you are interested in participating in the program as a student, please fill out our application Transformations Student Investigator Application (PDF) and return it to transformations@yourcrosspoint.org
I Would Like to Be a Volunteer Partner
Volunteers can participate as mentors or community partners.  Mentors work directly with students, helping them discover and utilize their skills.  Community partners advocate for students by building relationships among the broader community.

For information please email, or fill out the application below:
transformations@yourcrosspoint.org  or call Tyler at 850-678-4411

mentor application (PDF, you print and return to Niceville campus)
mentor application (word document, fill out digitally and email to Tyler)

I am Interested But Would like More Details
Want a broad overview of the program?  Take a look at this flyer:  Transformations Brochure
Want a detailed summary of how the program works?  Watch this short video.
Interested in volunteering but not sure how you fit in?  Take a minute to fill out Transformations Survey.
Or just contact the folks that know with questions:  transformations@yourcrosspoint.org

MISSIONARIES & AGENCIES

Our church supports missionaries all over the world. We love missionaries, from our own back yard to the ends of the Earth! We love seeing people meet Christ, we love helping people grow in their faith, we love serving through humanitarian and disaster relief efforts, we just love Missions!

Learn More

Local Missions
Crossroads Medical Clinic
Crosspoint Benevolence
Kids Kount Tutoring
Sharing and Caring
Supper on Saturday
The Bus Ministry
Transformations
Who We Support
PROJECTS WE SUPPORT
The Bargain Box
Crosspoint Benevolence
Family Life Ministry
Grace Rides

United Methodist Children’s Home

PEOPLE WE SUPPORT
Matt and Stacey Ayars | Haiti

How Can I Be Involved?
Pray | Be in prayer for our friends around the world, Here are some great tips to guide you as you pray!

GO | Are you interested in a mission trip?  Crosspoint sends teams all around the world all year long!  Contact tfuller@yourcrosspoint.org for current domestic and international opportunities.

Adopt | If you are in a small group, consider building a relational connection between your group and one of our missionaries!  Here is how it works, contact Tyler to start a conversation and get connected!

Supper on Saturday

Supper on Saturday delivers over 1,000 meals a week in Valparaiso and Niceville.  We make and distribute great food, but ask anyone and they’ll tell you “It’s not about the food.”  Every meal we serve represents a relationship between people that God loves and values!

Return to Missions Page

Learn More

I Want to Receive Meals
Call 678-4411 or email Becky at rfspence@earthlink.net for details.
I Want to Volunteer
Most volunteers serve once a month, if you’d like to give it a shot, choose a week and contact the corresponding Team Captain:

1st Saturday: Leonard and Jackie Goldman 850-217-7900 jgoldman1@valp.net
2nd Saturday: Larry Boyce 850-974-0499
3rd Saturday: Pete Peterson 850-897-3686 patpete@cox.net
4th Saturday: Lisa Gamon 850-217-2796 lisagamon@cox.net
5th Saturday: Generations United Church / Forest Lake Church

SOS News
2014 IN REVIEW

This past year Supper On Saturday volunteers served 45,794 meals, bringing our total, since the ministry began in 2006, to 354,371.  The bus ministry is bringing over 100 children and youth to church each Wednesday night, and over 50 on Sunday.  Kids Kount, the after-school tutoring program, is serving around 20 children from Plew Elementary at Rosemont Baptist Church. Many of the youth and adults who first became aware of the church through SOS are participating in the Transformations ministry, learning the skills needed to seek better job opportunities and grow spiritually.

Thanks to the Bargain Box and the Crosspoint Missions Committee for their financial support for these programs. Thanks to Sharing & Caring, Paneras, Winn Dixie and Publix for donations of bread and desserts each week. Crosspoint culinary staff supports our efforts every week.
We participated with Toys for Tots to deliver Christmas presents to the children on our routes. Many donate their time and resources to make sure our elementary children have an opportunity to go to Blue Lake camp each summer. Other small groups provide lunches for our bus kids each Sunday. At the beginning of each semester, small groups and volunteers provide an opportunity for the bus children to buy a new pair of shoes.

Each of these ministries provide exciting opportunities to reach out to those in our community who need assistance and to share Christ’s love.

Crosspoint volunteers enjoy working each week with volunteers from other churches in our community, including Niceville Assembly, St. Jude’s Episcopal, Shoreline, Holy Name of Jesus and Christ Our Redeemer Catholic churches, Grace Episcopal in Destin, Niceville First Baptist, Rocky Bayou and Rosemont Baptist churches, and others. We deliver any leftover food to Trinity UMC in Fort Walton to help with their feeding program each weekday.

New Member

Welcome! We are looking forward to our spiritual journey together.

Our mission statement is “to build a community where people can COME as they are, MEET Christ, GROW in their faith, and find a place to SERVE.” You have already come, and you know Christ. Now, grow in your faith by joining a life group. Become a part of what God is doing here by finding a place to serve. Finally, learn how to become a good steward by prayerful consideration of what God is calling you to give financially to fulfill your pledge to support our church with your “prayers, presence, gifts, service and witness.”

Just click on the links below to find a group, a place to serve and to give. Again, welcome! We are glad to have you as a member of our church.

SERVE CROSSPOINT STUDENTS

Opportunities, Forms & Schedules

Current Volunteer Opportunities

We hope you will consider becoming a part of a team of people who have the honor of working with Students at Crosspoint! If you are passionate about connecting students with Christ, here are some opportunities to consider:

Wednesday Night Leaders
These dedicated volunteers serve our Middle School in break out groups after the main teaching on Wednesday evenings. This involves a weekly commitment to Student Ministries on Wednesday evenings from 5:30 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. Opportunities to lead and to co-lead are available. Group size varies.

Sunday Morning Leads
Our goal on Sunday is to connect students to Christ. We do that through groups that study God’s word. There are opportunities to lead or co-lead at both 9:30 a.m. and 11:00 a.m.

Sunday Night Leaders
These dedicated volunteers serve our High School in break out groups after the main teaching on Sunday evening. This involves a weekly commitment to Student Ministries on Sunday evenings from 5:30 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. Opportunities to lead and to co-lead are available. Group size varies.

Life Group Leaders
These groups are the real heartbeat of our future ministry at Crosspoint. Life Group Leaders have the opportunity change students’ lives by engaging with students in a small group setting over a long period of time. Life groups meet in people’s homes or at the church. The age level, location, and the book or topic of study can be chosen by you and your Life Group.

Pumpkin Patch
This team coordinates the selling of pumpkins as a fundraiser once a year, including: set-up, tear down, handling money, advertising, securing workers and maintaining the pumpkin patch.

*Training is provided for all the above mentioned areas and our dedicated Student Ministers and Staff are here to support you.

Please contact our student ministries office at 678-4411, ext 151 or by emailing Twanette Rodgers, Administrative Assistant, at trodgers@yourcrosspoint.org with any questions.

WHEN HURTS HELP

“Can God still use me?” It is a question most of us have asked at some point. Each of us has fallen short of perfection and it is tempting to believe we are “unusable” because of our fears, failures, or even just fatigue. We presume that God would choose to use the most gifted, handsome, athletic, victorious, and intelligent people for His purposes. But that’s not God’s way. Your legacy awaits, but it depends on your ability to walk with a limp and allow your hurts to help!

BRING IT

As we enter into 2016, we believe God is challenging us to BRING IT.  However, this is more than just a challenge, it’s an invitation to BRING our best to God’s table through giving.  If we BRING our best to God’s table, God will use it to touch more lives, connect greater numbers of people to Christ, and help His Kingdom expand.  Let’s BRING IT!

FIXING US

Marriage isn’t easy! Nearly every married person at times thinks “something has to change.” A quick look at statistics and the lives of those around us tell us marriages need help and that even strong marriages can be messy! But where do you find help? FIXING US is about unlocking the principles to healthy and satisfying relationships and repairing struggling relationships. Whether you’re married or just want to understand the keys to successful relationships join us as we kick off the New Year and discover what FIXING US is all about.

content.rendered:
[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

REVIVAL: FANNING AN OLD FLAME INTO FIRE

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

Revival is a word that gets thrown around a lot in the Church, and what many Christians want to see happen again in our country. But what does it really look like and how can we be a part of making it happen where we are? Join us over the next 6 weeks as we look back at one of the greatest revivals in history and discover what we can do to help fan the old flame of revival back into a fire. Come be a part of sparking a move of God!

[/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

content.rendered:
MEDIA REQUEST FORM

  • The Creative Arts Ministry exists to Connect people to Christ through the Arts. Our mission is to Re-connect the arts with God to provide opportunities for people to Meet Christ in the church and the community. It's our desire to serve our church and every ministry within the church. Therefore, we hope to be clear and objective in receiving and fulfilling all media requests.

    Please submit requests six weeks before the completion date of your project.

    *required fields
    Choose from the above choices that you would like for a media request. The remainder of the form will be displayed according to the boxes that you check above.

  • VIDEOGRAPHY:

  • (In a short paragraph, describe what you want the final video to look like, i.e. staff spotlight, compilation of interviews/testimony, highlight etc. The more detail you provide the better we can understand the purpose and feel of the requested media and deliver a product that not only meets your needs, but exceeds your expectations.)

  • PHOTOGRAPHY:

  • (In a short paragraph, describe what the photo shoot is for)
  • (In a short paragraph, describe the details required for the photo shoot such as location, date, time, clothing required. The more detail you provide the better we can understand the purpose and feel of the requested media and deliver a product that not only meets your needs, but exceeds your expectations.)

  • PRINTED MATERIAL:

    If we need to update a design, please attach original design files

  • GRAPHICS:

    (special graphics not specified within Publications Request Form)

  • GRAPHICS/FILES?

    G:\All Staff Share Folder\_Crosspoint Publicity Graphics Drop Box

  • REQUEST NOTES:

    • Please submit requests six weeks before the completion date of your project.
    • All requests are pending final approval by Becca Fominaya.
    • No Media Request will be accepted through verbal means, email, or any other type of communication. A Media Request must be submitted to guarantee that we have all the information we need to create and deliver the requested piece.

[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

DARE TO DREAM

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

When we were young, we believed we could be anyone… and we were. Explorers, wanderers, athletes, whatever we could imagine. We weren’t afraid to dream. We were full of wonder and life, but something happened. We suppressed those dreams. Join us this fall as we Dare to Dream again. God is calling for a reawakening within us of the way we used to live, of the people we were meant to be. Come and rediscover the God-sized dream in you.

[/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_bottom=”20px”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

YOU ARE LOVED

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

Did you know that you are loved unconditionally? There is nothing you can do, or ever will do, that will make God love you any more or less than He does right now. Think about what life would be like if we could just believe that the God of the Universe loves us completely. Insecurity would disappear because we would be completely secure in God’s love. Fear would disappear. Anxiety would disappear, and there would be no need to constantly try to prove ourselves to others. That’s what life was meant to be. Join us as we kick off the new school year by rediscovering the love of God.

Help us spread the word that “you are loved” by God by taking a selfie at one of our Selfie Stations across our campus with you and your friends and posting it to your favorite social media site with hashtag: #youareloved #yourcrosspoint. Help us spread the word and have a little fun in the process!

content.rendered:
CROSSPOINT eLETTER

Thursday, August 9, 2018

From our Campus Pastor

Last August a group of concerned parents, along with several area churches (including ours), got together to pray for our students, teachers, administrators, families, and community right before school started. It was an awesome night of several hundred people coming together to stand for our community and against the enemy, and we are doing it again this year!

Our communities and families face unprecedented negative pressure such as addiction, mental health issues, and violence. We believe it’s our job as the Church to rally together to do something about that, and since this is a spiritual battle first and foremost, that starts with prayer; which this event centers on. The event is simply a time of prayer and worship, with a few interviews interspersed to help us understand how we can better pray for our community. The event is not sponsored by any one church, crosses denominational lines, and is being held at the Niceville High School Auditorium. In addition, a resource area will be available with various groups present for anyone who needs further help.

Here is a quick video to help catch the need and the vision.

Join us next Thursday night, August 16, 6:30 p.m. at the Niceville High School auditorium to pray for our community!

Other announcements:

  • HELPING THE NEXT GEN WIN (This weekend)
    Join us in a weekend worship service this weekend as we cast a vision for how we as a church can help the next generation win, and raise up a generation that loves Jesus!
  • DISCOVER CROSSPOINT (This weekend)
    Do you want to know more about Crosspoint? Please come and find out what drives our vision of connecting people to Christ. Join us on Sunday, August 12, 10:45 a.m. – noon, immediately following the 9:30 and 9:32 services, in the Crosspoint Theatre, upstairs in the Community Life Center. Contact Nathan Adkison, 850-678-4411, ext. 138 or nadkison@yourcrosspoint.org for more information. We look forward to seeing you there!
  • CROSSPOINT KIDS PARENT PEEK
    Discover what Crosspoint Kids is all about; our mission, our focus, and what our programs look like. Parents of kids 4 years – 4th grade are invited to join us on Wednesday, August 15 from 6:00-7:30 p.m. in the Crosswalk Theater on the 2nd floor in the Kids Building for a taste of what our kids experience each week. Contact lrenna@yourcrosspoint.org for more information.


Jeremy Smith
Campus Pastor

News & Announcements

Worship this Weekend

AUGUST 11-12, 2018 | “GEN NOW: Helping the Next Generation Win”

Saturday, August 11
6:00 p.m. Crosspoint Saturday Night – Contemporary (Community Life Center) – Rev. Jeremy Smith

Sunday, August 12
8:00 a.m. Traditional (Sanctuary) – Rev. Greg McKinnon
9:30 a.m. Contemporary (Sanctuary) – Rev. Greg McKinnon
9:32 a.m. *Contemporary (Community Life Center) – Rev. Jeremy Smith
11:00 a.m. Traditional (Sanctuary) – Rev. Greg McKinnon
11:02 a.m. Contemporary (Community Life Center) – Rev. Jeremy Smith

*Signing interpretation is provided at the 9:32 service.

Next Steps

DISCOVER CROSSPOINT:
Do you want to know more about Crosspoint? Please come and find out what drives our vision of connecting people to Christ. Join us on Sunday, August 12, 10:45 a.m. – noon, immediately following the 9:30 and 9:32 services, in the Crosspoint Theatre, upstairs in the Community Life Center. Contact Nathan Adkison, 850-678-4411, ext. 138 or nadkison@yourcrosspoint.org for more information. We look forward to seeing you there!


CROSSPOINT SERVES:
Do you want to know how God has uniquely gifted you to make a difference in your community? We invite you to Crosspoint Serves:
Sunday, August 19, from 10:45 a.m.- noon in the Crosspoint Theatre, upstairs in the Community Life Center. We believe God is calling you to a unique place of serving, please join us at Crosspoint Serves to find out how and enjoy some amazing food and time with our Ministry Leaders as well! For more information, contact Nathan Adkison, 850-678-4411, ext. 138 or nadkison@yourcrosspoint.org.

Crosspoint Kids

CROSSPOINT KIDS PAJAMAS & PANCAKES WEEKEND:
Didn’t you want to wear your PJ’s to church as a kid and eat pancakes? Crosspoint Kids is making every kid’s dream come true on Saturday, August 11 and Sunday, August 12! Pancakes will be served before service on Saturday and between the service hours on Sunday so kids coming or going can enjoy some mini-pancakes while wearing PJ’s at church! Volunteers and parents are encouraged to join in on the pajama fun! Join us on Saturday, August 11 or Sunday, August 12.


WATER NIGHT:
On Wednesday, August 15 from 6:00 – 7:30 p.m., all Kindergarteners-4th graders are invited to water night as we kick off a new school year. Wear clothes that can get wet and bring a towel. Check in at the Kids Building but pick up from the grass parking lot behind the Community Life Center. For more information, please contact pcaggiano@yourcrosspoint.org


CROSSPOINT KIDS PARENT PEEK:
Discover what Crosspoint Kids is all about; our mission, our focus, and what our programs look like. Parents of kids 4 years – 4th grade are invited to join us on Wednesday, August 15 from 6:00-7:30 p.m. in the Crosswalk Theater on the 2nd floor in the Kids Building for a taste of what our kids experience each week. Contact lrenna@yourcrosspoint.org for more information.


AUGUST ELEMENTARY FOCUS: THE HUNT – WISDOM IS WORTH SEARCHING FOR!
God wants us to discover wisdom. When we make the wise choice, we reflect the character of Jesus to people around us. That’s why giving kids a strong foundation of wisdom is important. We want them to be equipped to face whatever choices they may need to make in the future. Check out our preview video and our parent cue for August. Join us on Saturday evenings at 6:00 p.m., Sundays at 9:30 and 11:00 a.m. and Wednesdays at 6:00 p.m. at Crosspoint Kids.


AUGUST PRESCHOOL FOCUS: ANCHOR’S AWAY
We are super excited about our new theme as we head for water with Anchors Away. Our kids are going to grow up with more choices than ever on which way to go. This month, we will begin teaching our children that God’s way is perfect. In fact, GOD’S way is the ONLY way that is 100% the RIGHT way every, single time! Not my way. Not your way. God’s way! Check out our preview video and our parent cue for August. Join us on Saturday evenings at 6:00 p.m., Sundays at 9:30 and 11:00 a.m. and Wednesdays at 6:00 p.m. at Crosspoint Kids.

Crosspoint Students

NEXT GEN WEEKEND:
This Sunday is Next Gen Sunday, Students Ministry encourages families to attend worship together. There will be no classes meeting in the Student Center in the morning. Students are also encouraged to serve on Next Gen Sunday. If your Student is interested in serving they should wear any Student Ministry t-shirt and arrive 15 minutes prior to the start of service.

ROCK THE UNIVERSE:
High School Student’s trip to Orlando’s Universal Studios, Friday, September 7 through Sunday, September 9. Christian music and theme park excitement! Early bird rate is $250 until August 24. Regular rate is $275. Limited tickets available. Registration deadline is August 30. Register online.


UNITE:
UNITE is an event for grades 5-12 where all Crosspoint campus Student Ministries UNITE as one. This event is packed full of fun including a pre-service hangout zone with luau themed games and activities, food, a worship service, and breakout groups. Join us August 26 at the Community Life Center. Hang out starts at 5:00 p.m.

Niceville Strong Community Prayer Night

NICEVILLE STRONG:
Today’s communities and families face unprecedented negative pressures. Join us as we bring together community stakeholders, local churches, and resources for a night of music, speakers, and prayer to bring about transformative change. Come Thursday, August 16 at 6:30 p.m. for a community prayer rally in the Niceville High School auditorium.
Stephen Ministry

STEPHEN MINISTRY AWARENESS MEETING:
Searching for your place in Crosspoint’s ministries? Come to an awareness meeting on Sunday, August 19 at 10:45 a.m. in room 209. Learn about one-on-one care-giving and how you can walk with hurting members of Christ’s family. Will you answer the call God has placed on your heart to listen and care for those in need of a friend? Contact Herstel Carter, hcarter@yourcrosspoint.org or Maria White, marialyn67@gmail.com, for more information.
Active Adults 50+

YOUNG AT HEART:
Join us on August 14, 2018, 11:30 a.m. – 1:00 p.m. in the Fellowship Hall. Our program is Patrick McGraw’s Clear Captions, resources for the hearing impaired. $6 for lunch. Please make your reservation by Friday noon, August 10, by contacting Barbara Wilder at bwilder@yourcrosspoint.org,  or call 678-4411, ext. 123.

ONE DAY!
“One Day!” is an event for older adults across our conference. Join us for a day of great music by Gloryland and dynamic presentations by our own Lisa Ausley. This event is held at beautiful Blue Lake Camp on Saturday, September 15, 9:30 a.m. – 2:30 p.m. Transportation will be provided. Trip fee is $20. You may contact Barbara Wilder, bwilder@yourcrosspoint.org to register or register online with payment.

CHECK OUT OUR AUGUST BROCHURE:
Please check out the August brochure for details about other events and trips.

Mission of the Week

MISSION OF THE WEEK: BILLY AND DAWN RAY 
We thank God for the Rays ministry to Kurdish refugees who have been displaced by terrorist activities. We pray for the work of “The Refuge” a community center that is being utilized for the Gospel “for such a time as this.” Find out more about The Refuge Initiative on Facebook.
Called into Ministry?

CALLED INTO MINISTRY?
Do you think that you might be called into Ministry? If so, we would love to talk to you. Please email Jeremy Smith at jsmith@yourcrosspoint.org.
Wednesday Dinners

We now accept credit/debit cards for Wednesday Night Dinner! Please help us spread the word.

DINNER MENU:

Wednesday, August 15, 2018
Meatloaf
Mashed Potatoes
Brown Gravy
Italian Cut Green Beans
Biscuit
Éclair Cake
Child’s Option: Corndog
Salad Option: Harvest Chicken
Gluten Free: Meatloaf, Mashed Potatoes, Italian Cut Green Beans, Cheese Biscuit, Dessert.

Caring Concerns

[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

SQUARE PEG. ROUND HOLE.

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”0px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

Conform. It’s kind of a bad word in our culture, and yet we spend so much of our time, energy, and money trying to “fit in”. But what if God has more for us than just “fitting in”? What if the goal for our life is to not fit in, to not conform, but to be transformed instead? Maybe the reason we are so broken is because we’re a Square Peg trying to force ourselves into a Round Hole. We’re made for something different than anything this world offers, and we’ll never fit in to the life God has for us until we realize that. Join us this summer as we study Romans 12 and discover what God really wants for our life.

content.rendered:
[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

THE CIRCLE MAKER

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”0px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

Do you ever sense that there’s far more to prayer, and to God’s vision for your life, than what you’re experiencing? It’s time you learned from the legend of Honi the Circle Maker–a man bold enough to draw a circle in the sand and not budge from inside it until God answered his prayers for his people. What impossibly big dream is God calling you to draw a prayer circle around? Join us for this series that will help us uncover our heart’s deepest desires and God-given dreams and unleash them through the kind of audacious prayer that God delights to answer. (Based on the New York Times Bestseller, The Circle Maker, by Mark Batterson.)

content.rendered: Crosspoint Academy Nursery Registration

EASTER WEEKEND 2018

Everyone wants to experience a taste of greatness in life. It’s what drives so many to competition in every arena of life – from sports to music, academics to fashion, and even in cooking. This Easter we hope that you will come and experience something different as we discover what it means to be truly great, and the One who is GREATER THAN anything we will face in this world! We have multiple styles of worship with incredible kids programs. Gather your family and come celebrate Easter at Crosspoint!

Friday

March 30
6:30 p.m. | Good Friday Service, Community Life Center
Childcare is provided for 4th grade and below.

Saturday

March 31
5:00 p.m. | Contemporary (Community Life Center)
Free pizza immediately following the service.

7:00 p.m. | Contemporary (Community Life Center)
Free pizza starting at 6:30 p.m.

Kids programs are provided through Pre-K.

Sunday

April 1
8:00 a.m. Traditional (Sanctuary)

8:02 a.m. Contemporary (Community Life Center)
Come for free breakfast before the 8:02 service–starting at 7:15 a.m.

9:30 a.m. Contemporary (Sanctuary)

9:32 a.m. Contemporary (Community Life Center)

11:00 a.m. Traditional (Sanctuary)

11:02 a.m. Contemporary (Community Life Center)

Kids programs are provided for Pre-K and below at all services. Special Easter programs for kids K-4th grade are provided at 9:30 and 11:00 only.

All Sunday morning Life Groups are canceled.

Looking for Easter Services in South Crestview?
Visit yourcrosspointsc.org/worship/easter

Looking for Easter Services in North Crestview?
Visit yourcrosspointnc.org/worship/easter

Looking for Easter Services in Bluewater Bay?
Visit yourcrosspointbw.org/worship/easter

content.rendered: Childcare Survey

Crosspoint Academy Preschool & Childcare Survey

Crosspoint Academy places extreme importance on the feedback we receive from our families.  Because of this, we are respectfully asking you to take a few minutes of your time to carefully complete the online survey prior to May 15.

If you have multiple children enrolled in our school, please complete a survey for each child and be sure to select your child’s teacher in the first question. Thank you so much for your time!

Volunteer Survey

  • Thank you for your feedback. We hope to have you on our team again next summer!

[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

WHAT IF?

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”0px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

“What if?”  That phrase can strike fear in all of our hearts and minds as we consider all the things that could go wrong in our world, especially when it comes to our finances.  Security is one of our basic needs, and thinking about all the “what if’s” can cause panic and anxiety when we think about future plans.  But what if the “what if” question wasn’t as much about fear, but about possibility?  What if when we trust God, He can do far more with what we give, in our lives and in the lives of others, than we could possibly imagine or do on our own?  Join us for our series, WHAT IF…?, where we’ll be imagining what God would do through us if we would really trust Him with what He’s blessed us with.

content.rendered:
LIFE GROUPS

Connect to a “life group” with others, like you, who desire to grow in their faith. Whether enjoying time sharing and learning, or helping one another through the storms of life, our life group members get strength and more out of their Crosspoint relationships by “doing life together.”

Find life group opportunities by day of the week on our calendars below. Just click on the opportunities for specifics. Or, simply fill out this “Join a Group” form and we can match you with a group.

Join a Group

Contact for more information:

Stephanie Case
Life Group Minister
678-4411, ext. 146
scase@yourcrosspoint.org

Summer Schedule for Life Groups –  Lots of opportunities for life groups to have a family-oriented group night instead to enjoy the Summer together. Any questions please contact your life group leader or Stephanie Case at scase@yourcrosspoint.org.

GroupLink: We believe doing life together is better and brings us closer to Christ. Come and explore our life groups and find just the one for you to jump into on the 4th Sunday of the month at 10:45 a.m. in the Community Life Center Crosspoint Theatre. The next GroupLink is Sunday, August 26.  Please contact our Life Group Minister Stephanie Case at scase@yourcrosspoint.org for details.

Financial Peace University: This Dave Ramsey course empowers and teaches you how to handle money God’s way. Meets Wednesdays starting September 19,  6-7:30 p.m. in the Friendship Hall. Contact is Gerald Campbell at crosspointfinancialcounseling@gmail.com.

Learn More

Find a Life Group
Find a Short-Term Life Group
Simply click on the group name to open and view the complete description.

GIVE NOW

Give Online Now

Conveniently give from any device anytime, either as a one-time guest or by opening a secure account for convenient recurring giving. Credit cards accepted. Learn more (PDF).

Mobile Giving App

ShelbyNext Mobile Apps are available. Learn more…

  • Android (PDF)
  • iPhone (PDF)

The same username and password will work on both giving options above.

Request Giving Envelopes (850) 678-4411. For assistance, contact: Blane Pearson, Minister of Administration, or call (850) 678-4411, ext. 116.

Come, Meet, Grow, Serve…Give

We believe in the power of generosity. Learn how to fulfill your member’s pledge of “prayers, presence, gifts, service and witness”:

Pledge Now

WEBCAST


SUNDAY, AUGUST 12, 2018
“GEN NOW:
Helping the
Next Generation Win”
Jeremy Smith
9:32 a.m./11:02 a.m.
No Connect Notes

Crosspoint viewers, we have changed our internet streaming provider, and invite you to enjoy our worship services embedded here on our website, by clicking the play button in the middle of the video window during the scheduled times above. (You will not be redirected to another website in another web-browser tab).

To report issues, please click below. Include specific information such as: Wireless/Wired? Device? Browser? Internet Service Provider? Description of the issue?

Report Issues

More Messages

Search through a library of our messages and watch them in HD or listen to the audio online. Click below to start your search.

title.rendered: The “I Am” Sayings of Jesus Series

content.rendered:
[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

THE “I AM” SAYINGS OF JESUS

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”0px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

Have you ever noticed that sometimes Jesus says weird things in the Bible? For instance, in the Gospel of John, 7 times Jesus makes the statement “I am” and then gives a descriptor for Himself. Why does He do that? What was He trying to tell us about who He is, and who God is?

In this series, we take an in-depth look into who Jesus says He is.

[/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

Crosspoint Recreation

Crosspoint offers a very wide variety of sports programs, classes and groups to meet our community’s needs for recreation. From soccer, basketball and volleyball to dance, music and fitness classes, we have something you will enjoy.

While the programs are based in and out of the Community Life Center at the church, the programs are designed to welcome and encourage individuals of all faiths, all skill levels and all walks of life to come play!

This is about having fun! Join us and bring your friends!

Contact for more information:
850-678-4411, ext. 145 (Welcome Desk)

James Jetton
Recreation Minister
Email: jjetton@yourcrosspoint.org

Registrations & Announcements
 MEN’S BASKETBALL LEAGUE

This league is for 16 years and up. Registrations starts online  Adult Basketball Registration or in person at the Community Life Center on July 23. Game days will be on Monday and Tuesdays starting September 4 and ending with a tournament on October 22 and 23. Registration is $60 a person. You may register as a team or as an individual and be placed on a team. When our league reaches 12 teams, registration will close.

Men’s Basketball League 2018

 BEGINNER BASKETBALL

Registration starts July 23 online Beginner Basketball Registration or in person at the Community Life Center! This instructional program is for children 4,5 years and Kindergarten. This program will be held on Tuesdays from 4:45-5:30 p.m. starting September 11 and ending October 16. Children will travel from station to station learning basketball skills to establish a foundation to play organized basketball. Cost is $35 per player. Beginner Basketball 2018

NEWSLETTER

Simply sign up online to receive our monthly newsletter via

Aug 2018 pdf

PICK UP BASKETBALL GAME

Come join the group on Tuesday Mornings at 6 a.m. to play basketball. Shower and then head to work!

 HEALTH TIP

New Blood Pressure Guidelines

The new blood pressure guidelines established by the American Heart Association and the American College of Cardiology have redefined hypertension for all adults as 130mm Hg or higher or diastolic pressure of 80mm Hg or higher.  The result is that about 31 million Americans are now diagnosed as having hypertension.  The guidelines also emphasize the importance of tracking your blood pressure at home and coordinating treatment with your doctor.  The new guidelines are:

Normal  – -120/-80

Elevated  – 120 – 129/-80

Stage 1 Hypertension – 130 – 139/80 – 89

Stage 2 Hypertension – 140/90

Bottom Line – Patients with established hypertension should track their blood pressure at home using home monitoring equipment and coordinate follow-up care and treatment with their doctor. Next month will address things that must be done in order to accurately access blood pressure readings.

Hypertension, November 13, 2017

Wednesday, Friday | 6 a.m.-2 p.m.

POLICIES

Before you can use the gym, fitness room or take classes in our facility, you must complete a current Liability Release Form. There is a $30 fee for the year, prorated according to when you register. Hours vary. Pick up a schedule at our Welcome Desk.

Once you have registered, you are also asked to “check in” via the touch screen monitor at the Welcome Desk each time you use the facility. Children 12 and under are not allowed to use the facilities unless they are accompanied by a parent, therefore a release form is not required.

In order to use the Fitness Room, you must be 16 or older.

Please understand these policies exist so that all can enjoy keeping “fit” in a safe environment.

Celebrate Recovery

Come enjoy a “safe place” as we seek healing from those things that keep us from leading healthy, balanced, and godly lives. Celebrate Recovery is not just for those with addictions, but for everyone who suffers pain in their lives from hurts, habits and hang-ups that hold them back.

Come discover the “8 Recovery Principles” that can pave the road to wholeness, growth, and spiritual maturity.

Celebrate Recovery Friday Nights!

5:30 p.m. Optional “come as you are” dinner
$5.00 adults / $3.00 children / $15 max per family

6:30 p.m. Celebrate Recovery program
Celebration Place (Pre-Recovery Program) is provided for K – 5th grade students, 6:30 – 9:00 p.m.
The Landing (12-Step, Christ-centered recovery for all sorts of hurts, habits, and hang-ups) for 6 – 12th grade students, 6:30 – 9:00 p.m.

7:30 p.m. Open Share Groups (see our FAQ below for more information.)
Women’s: Chemical Dependency / Co-dependency / “A-Z” (other issues)
Men’s: Chemical Dependency / “A-Z” (life issues)

8:30–9:00 p.m. Dessert and fellowship

Nursery is provided for birth through Pre-K.

Directions | Campus Map

Follow Celebrate Recovery:

Contact for more information:

Stephanie Case
Phone: 850-678-4411, ext. 146
Email: scase@yourcrosspoint.org
