News and Announcements
CELEBRATE RECOVERY ONE DAY SEMINAR:

Celebrate Recovery Summit is coming July 11-13, 2018 in Hendersonville, TN. Great training and awesome fellowship and encouragement for both folks new to Celebrate Recovery and those who have been around awhile. Early Bird registration is $291 for individuals and $271 for groups (4 or more) and ends May 15. Regular rate registration is May 16 – July 3 at $311 Individual rate and $291 for groups. Go to www.celebraterecovery.com to register for the conference and contact Stephanie Case, scase@yourcrosspoint.org, regarding our block of saved hotel rooms.

Calendar
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
What is Celebrate Recovery?

Celebrate Recovery is a biblical and balanced program to help people overcome their hurts, habits, and hang-ups. Whatever is behind the pain in your life, procrastination, guilt, anger, rage, fear, anxiety, divorce, alcohol abuse, perfectionism, insecurity, overspending, overworking, overeating, grief, abuse, drugs, codependency, sexual addictions, hypochondria, hurtful relationships, gambling, lying or the need to control? Celebrate Recovery helps you face and resolve the problem behind the pain.

Who is it for?

Anyone and everyone.

What age groups are appropriate for participation?

Ages 18 and above for the adult program. We also have Celebration Place for K-5th grade students and The Landing for 6th-12th grade students.

Why do I need to attend?

We have all hurt ourselves, we’ve all hurt other people, and others have hurt us. This means each of us needs to heal from the effects these hurts have on us and from the control they have in our lives.

What will it do for me?

Celebrate Recovery will provide a safe place for you to begin to work on issues that have been keeping you trapped and separated from the life that God intended for you to live and, in some cases, things that have kept you separated from God.

How often will it meet?

Celebrate Recovery meets every Friday night.

What does a typical evening look like?

“Come as you are” dinner and fellowship begins at 5:30 p.m. Dinner is served until 6:15. A $5.00 donation is suggested.

  • Large group worship and teaching begins at 6:30 p.m.Everyone meets together for a time of worship then a teaching or a testimony in the Fellowship Hall. There is no pre-registration or sign-ups. Upon arrival you will be greeted by someone who will help you become acclimated.
  • Small gender-specific Open Share groups begin at 7:30 p.m.This is the time to break into recovery specific groups and share and hear from others with similar hurts, habits, and hang-ups.
  • Dessert and fellowship from 8:30–9:00 p.m. Everyone gathers together for this time in the Fellowship Hall.You are welcome to participate in any, or all, of the Friday night opportunities.

Where does it meet?

In the Fellowship Hall of Crosspoint United Methodist Church, Niceville, FL.

How do I get in?

You do not have to sign up; just show up!

What should I wear?

We encourage casual and comfortable.

Is childcare available?

Yes, for infants through PreK; no charge; 6:20-9:00 p.m. Parents/caregivers must remain on-site for Celebrate Recovery activities. We have Celebrate Recovery’s Celebration Place program for K-5th grade students. We also have Celebrate Recovery’s The Landing program for 6th-12th grade students.

How much does it cost?

There is not a sign-up fee.

How long does it last?

Though Celebrate Recovery is not a “course”; the structure of the teaching on Friday night repeats every year. This way you can begin anytime.

What materials are used and how much do they cost?

Materials available are: Celebrate Recovery Bible – $20.00, Celebrate Recovery Journal – $11.00, Participant’s Guides – $5.00 each. There are no mandatory purchases. More information is available at the resource table on Friday nights.

Are there groups for men and women?

The small groups are gender-specific.

Do I have to stand up and speak before a group of people?

No. There is no pressure, or requirement, to share.

Who are the leaders qualified for this type of ministry?

Like you, the leaders are people who are repenting and/or recovering from the hurts, habits, and hang-ups in their lives. They have completed the participant’s guides, have received the recommended training for leadership in Celebrate Recovery, remain accountable in their specific area of recovery, and desire to serve and help others find wholeness, growth, and spiritual maturity

What makes this program different from non-Christ-centered 12-step programs?

Most people are familiar with the classic 12-step programs of AA and other groups. Based on the actual words of Jesus, Celebrate Recovery incorporates the eight recovery principles, found in the Beatitudes, with the 12-steps.

Will there be anonymity for people to share their heartfelt concerns?

Yes. Providing a safe place where anonymity is respected is a priority.

How will I benefit from attending and completing Celebrate Recovery?

The “road to recovery” from our hurts, habits, and hang-ups leads to wholeness, growth, and spiritual maturity. It doesn’t get much better than that.

How can I get involved?

If you desire to serve, there are many different opportunities! Opportunities to serve will be made available at Friday night gatherings and through this web site.

What is a step study and where/when do the step studies meet?

The greatest growth and level of accountability takes place in the weekly step studies. Using the Celebrate Recovery participants guides, members of these gender-specific groups study each of the 12-steps and answer and discuss questions at the end of each lesson. (See the Step Studies link for a list of open step study groups).

How do I get more information?

  • Come join us!
  • Visit the Celebrate Recovery® international web site.
  • E-mail: scase@yourcrosspoint.org or call 678-4411 (Crosspoint United Methodist Church).

What is the Serenity Prayer?
by Reinhold Niebuhr

God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change,
The courage to change the things I can,
And the wisdom to know the difference.
Living one day at a time,
enjoying one moment at a time,
Accepting hardship as a pathway to peace;
Taking, as Jesus did,
This sinful world as it is;
Not as I would have it;
Trusting that You will make all things right
If I surrender to Your will; So that I may be reasonably happy in this life
And supremely happy with You forever in the next. AMEN.

Step Studies
The greatest growth and level of accountability takes place in the weekly step studies. Using the Celebrate Recovery participants guides, members of these gender-specific groups study each of the 12-steps and answer and discuss questions at the end of each lesson. Open step study groups are:

Women’s Step Studies:

  • Wednesdays, 6:00-7:30 pm, Sanctuary Prayer Chapel. Child care/programming available for birth through 8th grade.
  • Saturdays, 9:30-11 a.m., Community Life Center Room 955

Men’s Step Study:

  • Wednesdays, 6:00-7:30 p.m., Community Life Center Fitness Room. Child care/programming available for birth through 8th grade.

These groups are for men and women seeking a deeper understanding of themselves and their relationship with God through the 12 steps and 8 principles of Celebrate Recovery.  Contact Stephanie Case at scase@yourcrosspoint.org or 850-678-4411, ext. 146 for more information.

Childcare is available in the Kids Building for these studies.

As more leaders are trained, more new studies will become available.

The Landing (Students)

“The Landing” is for students in grades 6-12, Fridays, 6:30 – 9:00 p.m., and meets in the Fellowship Hall.  Optional dinner at 5:30 p.m.   The Landing is a place where you’ll experience freedom, healing and wholeness.  It’s a safe haven that will help you overcome life-controlling hurts, habits and hang-ups – or simply provide you with insights on following God’s path to greater freedom in your life.   Each week, you’ll meet with other teenagers who are traveling this journey.   You’ll spend time reading the Bible, discussing real-life topics, searching for answers to challenging situations, and encouraging one another as you grow.  Questions? Contact Stephanie Case at scase@yourcrosspoint.org

BENEVOLENCE

Our benevolence team is dedicated to charitable giving in the name of Jesus.  The team works hard to maintain systems that offer a hand-up and maintain the value and dignity of the individual in need.  Every day we provide the community with spiritual support, counseling, and material assistance for life essentials such as housing, utilities, healthcare, childcare and transportation.

Your generous gifts, prayers and volunteer time make this ministry possible. We always need the help of mechanics, handymen, electricians, plumbers, dentists, doctors and others. To make a donation, provide a service, or to ask for help, contact our Benevolence office at 678-4411, ext. 166.

603 McKinney Street (across from the main sanctuary)

Summer Hours:
Tuesday  10:00 a.m.-2:00 p.m.
1st and 3rd Thursday 9:00 a.m.-12:00 p.m.
2nd and 4th Thursday 10:00 a.m. – 2:00 p.m.
Friday 9:00 a.m.-12:00 p.m.

Need assistance? No appointment necessary. Come by during our hours of operation, or check out our Transformations program.

Benevolence is a mission of and supports the community and ministry of Crosspoint. For more information on our missions, please check out our Missions page.

Contact for more information:

Tyler Fuller
Missions Pastor
tfuller@yourcrosspoint.org

STEPHEN MINISTRY:

Recognizing a call to provide one-on-one Christian care to anyone facing a crisis, Stephen Ministry volunteers are equipped with the skills necessary to walk alongside those experiencing some of life’s hardest challenges–deployment, divorce, death of a loved one, job loss, just to name a few. They can be “Christ with skin on” when someone doubts the presence of God in their life. Their goal is transforming lives one at a time by demonstrating God’s love—free and confidential.

These Stephen Ministers are here to help others find the hand of Jesus when suffering. If you are in need of a Stephen Minister or if you have the gifts of mercy and compassion and would like to join our team of Christian Caregivers, contact Herstel Carter at 850-678-4411, ext. 130.

For more information, view the Stephen Ministry at Crosspoint Video (on Vimeo)

HEALTH TIP

New Blood Pressure Guidelines

The new blood pressure guidelines established by the American Heart Association and the American College of Cardiology have redefined hypertension for all adults as 130mm Hg or higher or diastolic pressure of 80mm Hg or higher.  The result is that about 31 million Americans are now diagnosed as having hypertension.  The guidelines also emphasize the importance of tracking your blood pressure at home and coordinating treatment with your doctor.  The new guidelines are:

Normal  – -120/-80

Elevated  – 120 – 129/-80

Stage 1 Hypertension – 130 – 139/80 – 89

Stage 2 Hypertension – 140/90

Bottom Line – Patients with established hypertension should track their blood pressure at home using home monitoring equipment and coordinate follow-up care and treatment with their doctor. Next month will address things that must be done in order to accurately access blood pressure readings.

Hypertension, November 13, 2017

Faith Community Nurse
FAITH COMMUNITY NURSE

Beth Tritschler, RN,BSN, FCN is our Faith Community Nurse. Faith Community Nursing (FCN) is a specialized practice of professional nursing that focuses on the promotion of holistic health. The FCN uses the nursing process to address the spiritual, physical, mental and social health of the individual. Using the interventions of education, counseling, prayer, presence, advocacy and referral to promote optimum health, Beth’s role is one of advocacy and empathy in guiding our congregants to be at their optimal state of health as they serve God. She can be contacted at btritschler@yourcrosspoint.org or by phone 850-218-2294.

Our Counselors

Deanna B. Eddy, LMHC
850-678-4411, ext. 166 | deddy@yourcrosspoint.org

Deanna graduated from Clemson University with a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology. Following graduation, she volunteered at a drug and alcohol rehabilitation center and worked for several years as a Senior Clinical Counselor with the South Carolina Department of Mental Health. Deanna graduated with honors with a Master of Science degree in Counseling and Psychology from Troy University. While employed at the Emerald Coast Children’s Advocacy Center, Deanna worked with children and families suffering from traumas such as domestic violence, physical and sexual abuse, and severe neglect.

Deanna has been published by the American Counselor’s Association (ACA) and was a featured speaker at the ACA’s 2011 conference on children and grief. Deanna meets her clients “where they are now” emotionally and walks with them as they journey toward healing and recovery.

Deanna Eddy’s primary counseling days/hours are Monday, Tuesday and Thursday from 9:00 a.m.-4:00 p.m., and Wednesday from 9:00 a.m.-1:00 p.m.

Alyssa Gavulic, Ph.D., LMHC, LMFT
850-678-4411, ext. 166 | agavulic@yourcrosspoint.org

Alyssa graduated from St. Edward’s University with a BA in Psychology and received her MA in Professional Counseling from Liberty University. She is currently completed her Ph.D., in Counseling Education and Supervision from Liberty University. Alyssa has an extensive background working with individuals, couples, families, active duty military, veteran, widow, and bereavement populations. Her expertise in these areas comes from her education and training as well as her personal experiences.

Alyssa engages her clients from a holistic perspective that strategically integrates several aspects of their life to help them move toward healing and wholeness. She specializes in resiliency, wellness, military unique stressors, trauma recovery, anxiety, depression, marriage and family therapy, parenting techniques, and complicated bereavement counseling.

Alyssa Gavulic’s primary counseling days/hours are on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

Leonard Goldman, LMHC
850-678-4411, ext. 166 | lgoldman@yourcrosspoint.org

Leonard graduated from the University of Florida with a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree and taught Art as Expression in Florida public schools. After a wide and varied career, he returned to school, earning his M.S. degree in Counseling and Psychology from Troy University. He is a Licensed Mental Health Counselor in the State of Florida. Leonard takes a holistic approach to counseling which includes physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual well-being.

In the therapeutic relationship of counseling, people come together, each bearing a message for the other. It is an opportunity for trust to be established within the safety of this relationship, allowing us to connect at those genuine, honest places of the heart. It is in these sacred moments that healing, change and growth can and do begin.

Leonard Goldman’s primary counseling days/hours are Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday from 9:00 a.m.-4:00 p.m.

Corie Putnam
850-678-4411, ext. 166 | cputnam@yourcrosspoint.org

Corie Putnam, LMHC, graduated from the Virginia Military Institute with a B.A. in Psychology. She graduated with hours from Walden University with a Master of Science in Marriage, Couples, and Family Counseling.

Corie’s work experience includes working with the severely mentally disabled in a community based setting and in group homes, with trauma and abuse with the Dept. of Children and Families as well as sexual and domestic violence with children K-12, and with adult students and adolescents in substance abuse counseling. Her specialties include marriage/couples issues, family issues, trauma, and treating substance/alcohol abuse. She is a veteran and a military spouse. Corie believes in treating the “whole person,” which includes the mental, physical, emotional, and spiritual aspects of each person.

Crosspoint Lead Pastor

Rev. Rurel Ausley

Now in his 20th year at Crosspoint, Rev. Rurel R. Ausley, Jr. has seen the church grow from 1,000 in attendance on one campus to an average weekend attendance of more than 3,800 on multiple campuses. According to the latest UMC statistics, (2016) Crosspoint is currently the 10th largest UMC, by attendance, and in top ten of the fastest growing large UM churches.

Rurel and Crosspoint are very involved in the Democratic Republic of Congo where Crosspoint has built 60+ churches and two parsonages in the last six years. Rurel has made nine trips to Africa in seven years training pastors for leadership, dedicating churches, and helping them understand the dynamics of the denomination’s General Conference.

Ordained an Elder in the Alabama West-Florida Conference in 1981, Rurel was elected in 2008 and 2012 by the Alabama West Florida Conference to the denomination’s General Conference and five times to the Jurisdictional Conference.

Rurel received his B.A. degree in Sociology/Bible from Asbury University, and his Master of Divinity degree from Asbury Theological Seminary in Wilmore, Kentucky. It was in seminary that he met and married his wife, Lisa. Lisa is a Deacon, now serving at Crosspoint, South Crestview Campus. They have three adult sons: Matthew (Kristin), Andrew (Ellen), and Luke, and four grandbabies, Levi, Benaiah, Nate, and Joy.

MEDIA

Watch or listen to our most recent message below! Join us for the live webcast, and/or check out the archives for more messages, music, and other videos.

Israel’s King David is one of the Bible’s most famous people. We tend to look at Bible heroes through rose-colored glasses, but David was a man of great “highs” and terrible “lows” and the Bible doesn’t whitewash the flaws of this hero of the faith. In spite of it all, the Bible refers to David as “a man after God’s own heart”! Join us in this summer series as we look at a great number of lessons that we can learn from David–lessons that are as relevant and helpful today as then.

AUGUST PRESCHOOL FOCUS:  ANCHOR’S AWAY:
Preschool Parent Cue | Monthly Video Preview We’re going to keep riding our bikes and trikes right into this month—only we’ll be switching gears with a new bottom line. Last month, we taught our preschoolers that the Bible tells us which way to go.  This month, we’re going to teach our preschoolers that God’s word is with us wherever we go. Although we may outgrow our bikes and trikes, we will never out grow our need for God’s Word.

AUGUST ELEMENTARY FOCUS:  THE HUNT – WISDOM IS WORTH SEARCHING FOR:
Elementary Parent Cue | Monthly Video Preview God is stronger than anyone and He can do things that would be impossible for you or me. He has proven this throughout history, but nowhere is this more evident than in the life, death, and resurrection of Jesus. Because of what Jesus has done, we can have confidence. And when you put your faith in Jesus, you can live fully alive.

A specialty salad is available as an alternate option to the entree.  If you would like a salad, please be sure to make reservations so the Culinary Team prepares enough. The specialty salads rotate on a 4 week basis and include Chicken Salad, Greek Chicken, Chef, and Harvest Chicken.

Note: Kids programing (for those staying for classes/groups) opens at 5:50 p.m.

WOMEN’S MINISTRY

Crosspoint offers a variety of groups to meet the needs of women of all ages and stages. No matter your season of life or walk of faith, we welcome you! Especially consider joining Women of the Word (WOW), or MOPS (Mothers of Preschoolers). Each October, Crosspoint Women host the World Bazaar and Benefit. You will find an opportunity to deepen your faith in Christ, build deep friendships and find rewarding opportunities to serve. See more information below.

Follow Crosspoint Niceville Women:

Suzanne Niedbalski
Women and Prayer Minister

sniedbalski@yourcrosspoint.org

Women of the Word
WOMEN OF THE WORD

NEW STUDY: What Matters Most by Karen Ehman

REGISTER TODAY for WOW’s fall study!

Join us as we study Paul’s letter to the Philippians through Karen Ehman’s book What Matters Most. Through 7 sessions, learn to deepen your relationship with Jesus, turn your worries into worship and develop tools for navigating conflict.

Women of the Word (WOW) meets every Thursday from 9:30-12:00 starting September 6, 2018 in the Niceville Fellowship Hall for Bible study, worship, and fellowship (childcare provided for infant through Pre K).  Register here: Crosspoint Women

MOPS (Mothers of Preschoolers) and MOPS Kids
MOPS first meeting is Monday, August 20.  MOPS meets in the Fellowship Hall the 2nd and 4th Monday of each month, August through May, 9:30 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. MOPS meetings consist of fellowship, crafts, guest speakers, devotionals, and brunch. Semester dues are collected in September and January, $35 per semester.

MOPS KIDS are cared for during the MOPS fellowship, in a loving environment in our Children’s Building. Divided into age-appropriate groups, MOPS Kids are involved in planned activities such as games, stories, crafts, music, and physical play. All of our MOPS Kids workers are carefully screened by both MOPS members and Crosspoint United Methodist Church staff.  Visit Crosspoint Kids for more information.

Registration is currently open.  Registration will temporarily close Friday, August 18 and resume as a standby registration on Friday, September 15.

Follow these simple steps to register yourself and your child.

  1. Register yourself: Go to Crosspoint MOPS 2018-2019 Registration to register for Crosspoint MOPS, current or new members.
  2. Check out facebook.com/CrosspointNicevilleMops/ for all up-to-date information.

*ALL applicants be sure to pay international MOPS fees, and include accurate addresses, phone numbers, and children’s names and birth dates when registering.

For more information, contact Tricia Wise or Megan Parks at mops.crosspoint@gmail.com

Missions

Our mission of connecting people to Christ begins locally and stretches around the globe. We serve supper to build relationships in our community, and provide help in ways that honor the God-given dignity of every person. We support missionaries all over the world, and love taking short-term trips. We have a thrift store that turns donations into support for mission projects. We look for God at work, and we jump in!

“Missions home base” is upstairs in the Community Life Center (Niceville Campus). Follow us on Facebook or contact Tyler Fuller.  The Bargain Box and Supper on Saturday also have fantastic Facebook pages.

Contact for more information:

Tyler Fuller
Missions Pastor
850-678-4411, ext 153
tfuller@yourcrosspoint.org

Mission Trips: Looking for information on current mission trips? Take a look at the Trips menu below for information on dates, and our trip application. Contact TFuller@yourcrosspoint.org or @Crosspointmissions on facebook to chat about upcoming trips!

Giving to Mission Trip Participants: Do you have a friend or a loved one going on a Crosspoint Mission Trip? You can contribute to their ministry by following this link. Create a username/log-in, click on the “Mission Trips” tab at the top of the page. Choose the trip they are going on in the “trip information” box below the picture. And give a gift that helps change them, and the field they are visiting!

Current Mission Trips
How to Sign Up For a Trip:
1. Fill out a Trip Application (paper copies available at your campus)
2. Send application to TFuller@yourcrosspoint.org
(After filling out information, save it to your device, then attach it to an email)
3. Turn in a Deposit – see your trip’s information for deposit amount and schedule
4. Attend Team Training
5. Go with your team to be a part of what God is doing around the world!

Japan Trip with Dynamic Women for Mission
Dates: October 1-12
Deposit: $1,000 by June 15
Total Cost: $1,800
What will we do: Encourage and empower women from Japanese churches by teaching them to share their faith. Part of the training includes putting on a women’s conference for local churches.
*no need to use the Crosspoint Application for this trip, Dynamic women has their own application. Just ask Shannon!
Contact SRice@onemissionsociety.org for details

Mexico Trip with South Crestview Campus Pastor Brice Early
Dates: October 6-13
What will we do: Work with our missionary partners Bill and Renee Martin to support their church and outreach project in the local dump in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico. Vacation Bible School, Light Construction, and Evangelism are all par for the course on this trip.
Contact CBurnett@yourcrosspoint.org or details

Orphan Weekend
How does this all work:
There is a lot to know when it comes to foster care, adoption, and all of the ways we support kids. Tyler Fuller, Crosspoint’s mission pastor has written extensively on his personal blog about these sort of issues. These three posts may be a helpful introduction for you:
Ten Ways to be Involved in Orphan Care
How Adoption Works
The Fuller Family Story (part 3)

Oct 29 Free Lunch and Info Meeting:
The October 29 lunch meeting at North Crestview and Niceville campuses will include 5 minute presentations from representatives of the Guardian Ad Litem Program, Foster Care, International and Domestic Adoption, Foster and Adoptive Support Team, and Short Term Trips. After a short introduction there will be a group Q/A over lunch. The event will end with an opportunity to follow up with any of the areas through one on one conversation in an informal “job fair” style environment. No Reservation Necessary! Come ready to explore what role you could play in the lives of vulnerable children.

Foster and Adoptive Support Team:
Crosspoint is establishing a formal support system for families who have taken in children and teens through the foster care system, or adopted. This team will be a network of folks connected by email and social media available to meet needs and encourage caretakers. Help cook meals for a family who just got a new child, help locate and deliver baby supplies for an unexpected new arrival. Send encouraging cards or gift cards, bake cookies – be part of the ‘village’ it takes to raise every child. Even when that child arrived in a quick or unexpected way.  Every need will be offered to the entire team and met on a first-come first serve basis — an ‘opt in’ system. Help how you can when you can!

Short Term Trips and Child Sponsorship:
Crosspoint Mission trips to Haiti and Guatemala include an opportunity to sponsor a child in a community we have an ongoing relationship with. It’s more than just sending a monthly check, it’s about a long term relationship – you can meet the family you sponsor. You can see your letter posted on the wall of their home!  Our 410 Bridge trips to Haiti include this opportunity, if you are interested there is a 410 trip open right now!  See the trips menu for details.

We’re not ok. Ever wonder why we can’t get it together and why everything seems to be falling apart around us? Sin. We always hear that all sins are the same, and that’s true, but from early on in the church there have been a few singled out as the cause of others. Join us for our new series, SEVEN, as we discover not only what the 7 Deadly Sins are, and how to identify them in our lives, but also how to let God overcome and redeem them.

Crosspoint Serves Form

Welcome! We’re excited that you’re interested in serving at Crosspoint. As you serve here you will discover opportunities for community, giving back to others and leveraging personal gifts and skills to contribute to the vision we share: Connecting People to Christ.

Jeremy Smith
Campus Pastor

  • God has called you and uniquely gifted you.

    Questions? Contact Nathan Adkison, Next Steps Pastor, nadkison@yourcrosspoint.org, 850-678-4411.

    *required fields

  • KIDS

  • STUDENTS

  • CREATIVE

  • GUEST SERVICES

  • MISSIONS

  • CAMPUS SUPPORT

  • OTHER

[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

PARENTAL GUIDANCE

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”0px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

Kids aren’t born with a manual for how to raise them, and raising our children well in today’s society is even tougher. But raising up the next generation is the most important job every single one of us has.

In this series, we’ll be exploring ways to raise up the next generation successfully. This series will help you if you are a: parent, teacher, grandparent, coach, neighbor, childcare worker, youth worker, or mentor with kids in any way. Join us in the new year as we take a look at God’s guide, in our new message series, Parental Guidance.

title.rendered: “Speak to Me: How to Hear from God” Message Series

content.rendered:
[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

SPEAK TO ME: HOW TO HEAR FROM GOD

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”0px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

People always ask, “How do you hear from God?” because it seems like He is always talking to people in the Bible–but most of us feel like He never speaks to us.

In this series, we look at how God spoke to people in the Bible and learn how to listen when God is speaking to you.

[/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

content.rendered:
[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

THE JOURNEY

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”0px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

The Bible is one book made up of 66 other books written over the course of roughly 1,600 years with somewhere around 40 contributing authors; and yet, the overarching story of the Bible is the same: there is a God who wants a relationship with His creation… with you and me! Every single story, every character, every book points to that one story line. The narrative of the Bible is really The Journey to a restored relationship with God. Come rediscover some old stories through a new perspective as we look forward to celebrating Jesus’ resurrection with our Easter series, The Journey.

content.rendered:
[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

FIRST

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”0px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

What we put first in our life matters. If we’ll choose to put God FIRST, in our living and giving, we can touch more lives, connect greater numbers of folks to Christ, and help the Kingdom of God expand. As a church we’ve experienced God do more things through us this past year than ever before, and we think we are just seeing the beginning of what God is going to do as we allow Him to use us! Let’s keep God FIRST, and see what God can do!

EXPECTATION GAP

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”0px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

We all live in a gap. The gap between what we expect and what we experience. It’s where our dreams die and passions fade. It’s often the birthplace of our frustration, disappointment, and discouragement. But there’s a solution. There is a way to reconcile this space between. In this series we learn about the Expectation Gap and the God who is able to bridge it all.

content.rendered:
VBS VOLUNTEER HEADQUARTERS
Click Here to View 2018 VBS Photos

We have ventured onto an uncharted island where kids survive and thrive and anchored kids in the truth that Jesus carries them through life’s storms. Each day at Shipwrecked VBS, our kids traveled through fun rotations that reinforce relevant Bible Points and immersed kids in new adventures.

Join us in June of 2019 for our next VBS adventure!

Frequently Asked Questions
When Is Vacation Bible School this year?
On our Niceville campus, Shipwrecked VBS 2018 will be from 9:00 a.m. – 12:15 p.m., Monday – Friday, June 11-15, 2018.

When will registration open?
Registration will open Saturday, April 14, 2018.
During pre-registration (Saturday, April 14, 2018– Wednesday, May 14, 2018) you can take advantage of early bird pricing, pre-ordering a t-shirt and the ability to request a friend.

Registration will be closed from 11:00 p.m. on Wednesday, June 6 and reopen on Monday, June 11 at 8:00 a.m. to allow time to prepare for VBS. During this time, we will have a waiting list and will allow registrations on Sunday evening to those on the waiting list as space is available. During the week of VBS, registration will be open from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 a.m., Monday – Thursday, as space is available. Registration ends on Thursday, June 14, 2018.

My child would like to be placed with their friend. How do I request this?
One friend requests of the same age/grade can be indicated on the registration form during the pre-registration period. Please note that friend requests are only available during the pre-registration period only and both children must be registered during the pre-registration period and request each other. The closer it gets to VBS, the more difficult it becomes for us to honor requests of this nature, therefore, after Wednesday, May 14, friend requests will not be taken. We will make every effort to place your child with one of the friend requests submitted.

What measures are taken to ensure the safety of our children?
To ensure the safety of each and every child, you will need to present a photo ID to the child’s teacher who will check the name against the list of people you have designated on your registration form to pick up your child.

How will I know which class my child has been assigned to?
On Saturday, June 9, you will receive an email (to the email address you indicated when you registered your child for VBS) with your child’s class assignment listed.

Please be sure to check your email prior to the opening day of VBS. Additionally, our greeters will have class assignment lists available to check your class assignment when you arrive for VBS.

Where do I drop off my child in the mornings?
Rising Kindergarten classes meet in the Kids Building

Rising 1st – 4th grade classes meet in the Sanctuary for opening each day.

Please note that classes are based on the grade that your child will be attending during the fall of 2018.

What if I have problems with my computer and cannot register before it closes?
We will have computers set up in the welcome area of the Kids Building that you can use to register at any time that registration is open. During the week of VBS, there will be computers in the hub area just outside the Kids Building where you can register.

What age can children attend VBS?
Shipwrecked VBS 2018 is open to children who will be entering kindergarten in the fall of 2018, through rising 4th graders. Rising 5th grade students will be participating in Student Ministry activities at a different time. For more information or to register for rising 5th graders please visit our Student Ministry web page. Nursery care during the days of VBS is available ONLY to children of VBS volunteers who are younger than rising kindergarten.

Can my teenager volunteer for VBS?
Yes!! We depend on our student helpers to make VBS run smoothly each year. Students currently finishing 6th-12th grades can serve as youth volunteers. However, completed 6th grade students must volunteer with their parent or a willing adult sponsor. In fact, VBS needs the help of your teens! All student helpers must attend training prior to VBS.

How can adults volunteer to help the week of VBS?
There are many ways adults can help the week of VBS! The main way is by being a group leader for rising kindergarten – 4th grade children. In this role, you’ll experience everything VBS has to offer. There are other opportunities as well. Please check out our volunteer page for a list of opportunities to help with VBS.

I can’t volunteer during the week of VBS, but how can I help?
There are several opportunities to help for those who cannot be here the week of VBS. You can adopt one or more décor projects to complete before VBS begins. If you like counting, sorting and organizing materials, we could use your help before VBS begins. Please check out our Volunteer Opportunities accordion for a list of opportunities to help with VBS this year.

Is there a place to volunteer where I’m not with children?
We have several places to serve that don’t require that you are  with kids all morning. Greeters, parking and shuttle volunteers and snacks are all places to enjoy the thrill of VBS.

How much does VBS cost?
During the pre-registration period (Saturday, April 28 – Wednesday, May 23), the cost per child is $15.
After May 24, the cost per child is $20.
Scholarships are available upon request.

Will there be T shirts for sale?
If you register during the pre-registration period (Saturday, April 14 – Monday, May 14), you can order a t-shirt through your registration. After May 14, a limited supply of t-shirts may be purchased during the week of VBS at the t-shirt table.

What if I have other questions?
If you have additional questions, please email us at vbs-nv@yourcrosspoint.org and we will do our best to answer any questions that you have.

Daily Bible Point

Printable list of each daily Bible Point, Key Bible Verse and Bible Story

Monday

Tuesday

Wednesday

Thursday

Friday

Celebration Sunday - June 17

Celebration Sunday | June 17, 2018

Our closing program for VBS families & friends is Sunday morning,

June 17 during church services in the Community Life Center.
You don’t want to miss your children as they perform
and share some of what they learned at VBS.

9:32 Service in the Community Life Center (CLC)

Any class that ends in the following number/letter:
A, C, E, G, J
Drop off at 9:10 a.m. in the location listed below. Your child will receive a sticker
and you a parent pick up sticker. Please wear that sticker to enter
the kids building and pick up your child at the end of the hour.

11:02 Service in the Community Life Center (CLC)

Any class that ends in the following number/letter
B, D, F, H, K, L
Drop off at 10:40 a.m. in the location listed below. Your child will receive a sticker and you a parent pick up sticker. Please wear that sticker to enter
the kids building and pick up your child at the end of the hour.

Age Drop Off Location Pick Up Location
Rising Kindergarten 907 & 909/911 (CLC) Beach Theater C203 (Kids Building)
Rising 1st Grade 912 & 914 (CLC) Beach Theater C203 (Kids Building)
Rising 2nd – 4th Grade Back 5 rows of CLC Crosswalk Theater (Kids Building)

While you are in church service, your children will be enjoying
the last few moments of their VBS experience.
We encourage you to pick up your children at the conclusion of the service.

Nursery is available for younger siblings
in our Kids Building.

Thank you for allowing us to minister to your child(ren) during Vacation Bible School! If you have any concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us at
vbs-nv@yourcrosspoint.org.

We hope to see you at Celebration Sunday!

Music Links
2018 VBS Music is here!

You can access all of the videos in our YouTube playlist and you can access all of the songs in our Spotify playlist. If you would like to access songs individually, please see the chart below.

[vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”20px” padding_bottom=”20px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/1″]

REGROUP

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row inner_container=”true” no_margin=”true” padding_top=”0px” padding_bottom=”0px” border=”none”][vc_column width=”1/2″]

When life gets especially hectic and difficult, we all need a little time to ReGroup and recover, and we don’t think you should have to do that alone. Everyone needs authentic community and people around us to help keep us going. Every year we try to emphasize just how important it is to be in a small group, whether you’re a follower of Jesus or not, where we can encourage and support each other, ask questions, and just do life together with people we know are going to be there for us. If you’ve never joined a small group, now’s your time!

content.rendered:
Crosspoint Academy

The premiere preschool in the Niceville area, Crosspoint Academy offers full and part-time pre-kindergarten (ages 3-5) and childcare (birth – 2) in a safe, loving and enrichment-filled environment. Our goal is to help your child grow academically, physically, socially and spiritually. We place extreme importance on keeping Christ central in all aspects of our curriculum.

Crosspoint Academy is an authorized VPK provider for the 2018-2019 school year. Crosspoint Academy is licensed by the Florida Department of Children and Families. Tours are available by appointment. Call 678-4411, extension 187.

Crosspoint Academy | 214 S. Partin Drive | Niceville, FL 32578
Hours of Operation | Monday – Friday | 7:30 a.m. – 5:30 p.m.

Contact for more information:

Lauren McElroy
Crosspoint Academy Director
850-678-4411, ext 196
lmcelroy@yourcrosspoint.org

2018-2019 SCHOOL YEAR REGISTRATION
At this time, all 2018-2019 classes are full, but we occasionally experience withdrawals, so please add your child to our wait-list by scrolling down to the preschool or childcare tabs below.
Preschool | Children 3 or 4 before Sept. 1, 2018
Childcare | Birth – 2 years

EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES
Crosspoint Academy is accepting applications for full- and part-time teachers, assistant teachers and substitutes for the 2018-2019 school year (August 9, 2018 – May 30, 2019). Please note that full-time childcare positions are year-round. Hours range from 7:15 a.m. – 5:45 p.m. and days vary. Applicants must be willing to obtain necessary training hours to meet state licensing requirements. Please download an application, print, complete, and submit in person to the Kids Welcome Desk. For more information regarding these positions, please contact Lauren McElroy at 850-678-4411 ext. 196 or e-mail lmcelroy@yourcrosspoint.org.

Learn More

About Crosspoint Academy
MISSION

To provide children with a strong foundation for: a meaningful relationship with God, future academic success and a compelling sense of social responsibility by providing activities and opportunities for spiritual, cognitive, physical, social, and emotional growth. An outreach ministry of our church, Crosspoint Academy strives to meet the needs of children and encourage the development of Christian families through parent participation and education.

STATEMENT OF FAITH

We believe the Bible to be the inspired, the only infallible, authoritative Word of God. We believe that there is one God, eternally existent in three persons: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit. We believe in the deity of our Lord Jesus Christ, in His Virgin birth, in His sinless life, in His miracles, in His death on a cross as a sacrifice for our sins, in His bodily resurrection, in His ascension to the right hand of the Father, and in His personal return in power and glory. We believe that for a person to be saved from the condemnation of sin, he or she must experience a spiritual birth by personal faith in Jesus Christ as the Son of God. We believe in the personal ministry of the Holy Spirit by whose indwelling the Christian is enabled to live a godly life. We believe in the resurrection of both the saved and the lost; they that are saved are raised to life everlasting, and they that are lost are raised to judgment and condemnation. We believe in the spiritual unity of believers in our Lord Jesus Christ made evident through the church which is called the “body of Christ”.

LICENSING

Crosspoint Academy is licensed by the Florida Department of Children and Families.

DISCIPLINE

We believe children are best helped by a firm but gentle, calm, and consistent approach, determined by the child’s understanding and stage of development. Teachers utilize redirection, positive reinforcement, and the occasional use of a “thoughtful spot” followed by a positive discussion with a child about expected behavior. Parents are kept informed of their child’s progress and any repeated discipline issues. At no time will a child be subjected to discipline which is severe, humiliating, frightening or associated with food, rest, or toileting. Spanking or any form of physical punishment is prohibited for all child care personnel. Children may not be denied active play as a consequence of misbehavior. Should repeated discipline issues continue with any child, the Crosspoint Academy administration reserves the right to dismiss the child with approval from the Kids Ministry office. Any major infractions such as physical bodily harm will result in immediate dismissal. Tuition is not refunded for disciplinary dismissals.

Preschool Registration Information
2018-2019 Preschool Online Registration

All of our preschool classes are currently full, though we often experience withdrawals. If you would like to add your child’s name to the wait list please click on the appropriate link below.

Enrollment is open to any toilet-trained child who is 3- or 4-years old by September 1, 2018.

VPK voucher is not required at the time of registration. Parents of registered children will be notified once we are VPK approved. Please refer to policies here for more details.

For all available classes, rates and policies, please see our Class Options page. ALL children, even those currently enrolled, must re-register for the upcoming terms. No slots or days are reserved until the online registration forms are submitted and the registration fee is paid. Registrations will be processed on a first-come, first-serve basis.

Highlights and Daily Activities
PRESCHOOL HIGHLIGHTS

  • Ages 3, 4 and 5
  • Two, three, and five-day programs
  • Strong Christian environment and curriculum
  • Comprehensive Language Development
  • Specialized preschool math program
  • Excellent student/teacher ratio
  • Certified music and physical education instructors
  • Weekly Chapel
  • Extended care program
  • Uniform t-shirts

PRESCHOOL ACTIVITIES

  • Circle time
  • Whole group math studies
  • Small group math studies
  • Chapel centers
  • Free choice in classroom
  • Music
  • Playground time
  • Lunch
  • Circle story time
  • Whole group language arts
  • Small group language arts
  • Arts & crafts
  • Physical education

CHILDCARE PROGRAM HIGHLIGHTS

  • Full-time childcare services for children birth–preschool from 7:30 a.m. – 5:30 p.m. daily.
  • Part-time childcare services for children birth through preschool, single or multiple days from 9:30 a.m.-2:00 p.m.
  • Strong Christian environment
  • Daily Bible activities
  • Monthly thematic units with a comprehensive language component
  • Excellent student/teacher ratio
  • Indoor and outdoor play
  • Music and movement
  • Creative arts and exploration

content.rendered:
This is an example page. It’s different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I’m a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin’ caught in the rain.)

…or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!
